responses.content:

To infer that "The exam must have been difficult and covered all chapters", we would need additional information or premises that link covering all chapters to the exam being difficult. However, this link is not present in the original statement.

It is possible for an exam to cover all chapters without necessarily being difficult. The difficulty of an exam can depend on various factors such as the complexity of the questions, the time allowed, the students' preparation, etc. Merely covering all chapters does not automatically make an exam difficult.

Therefore, based on the given information, we cannot logically infer that the exam must have been difficult in addition to covering all chapters.

Answer: no
